title: [Self-directed] Blended Learning Design to Enhance the Effectiveness of Applying Instructional Design Principles in Print Quality Control Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic printing process knowledge and fundamental quality control concepts
context.additional_context: An intensive short-term program for job seekers to strengthen practical skills, offering blended learning environments combining e-learning tools with offline practice. BYOD and access to digital production tools like Adobe Creative Cloud are essential

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and evaluate instructional materials with over 80% accuracy by applying instructional design principles: goal clarity, content-objective alignment, and information visualization strategies.
Learners can produce print quality management simulation content with a 90% completion rate using e-learning tools (Adobe Photoshop, Flash, etc.).

Learners can submit practical case analysis reports based on print quality evaluation criteria in a blended learning environment at least three times and achieve 75 points or above (out of 100) in assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
